New Records: Yoshinobu Yamamoto pitched five brilliant innings, allowing two hits and two strikeouts, inducing a double play, and retiring the last seven batters.
Enrique Hernandez hit his 14th post-season home run, giving the Dodgers an early lead.
Key Match Events: The game was a historic duel between Japanese-born pitchers Yoshinobu Yamamoto and Yu Darvish.
Enrique Hernandez's solo home run in the second inning put the Dodgers ahead.
Teoscar Hernandez launched a 420-foot blast in the seventh inning, extending the Dodgers' lead.
Post-Match Reflections: The Dodgers advanced to the National League Championship Series for the first time since 2021.
Shohei Ohtani will have a chance to play in the playoffs with the Dodgers after a significant move from the Los Angeles Angels.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game marked a significant milestone for Japanese-born pitchers in MLB post-season matchups.
The victory highlighted the Dodgers' resilience and their journey to the playoffs.
